title: Amsterdam-bound flight makes emergency landing in Maine
text:
A United Airlines flight with more than 200 people on board has made an emergency landing in Maine.

Flight 968 left San Francisco at 2.54pm yesterday and was due to land in Amsterdam at 10.20am today local time.

But a cabin pressure issue diverted the plane and instead it made an emergency landing in Bangor, Maine, at around 1.30am.

A United Airlines flight with more than 200 people on board has made an emergency landing in Maine (file photo)

A United Airlines spokesman says the 13 crew members helped 197 passengers safely off the plane.

He said the airline was working to provide overnight accommodations to customers who would fly on Monday afternoon to Newark, New Jersey, and from there to Amsterdam, arriving Tuesday morning.

It was rescheduled to depart Bangor for Amsterdam at 8.15am Eastern time, according to the United Airlines website.

It is now scheduled to land in the Dutch capital at 1.35pm.

Details about the cabin pressurization issue were not available.

A 2005 AP story exploring the Bangor airport's role as a haven for diverted planes said the airport created from the former Dow Air Force Base is the last US airport for outgoing flights to Europe.
description: A United Airlines flight heading to Amsterdam with more than 200 people on board has made an emergency landing in Maine after experiencing cabin pressure issues.
